Title:
A new lichenized fungus, Orientophila corticola, from South
Korea, with a key to the genus
Abstract:
Orientophila corticola Lee is described as a new
lichenized fungus from South Korea. The new species is distinguishable
from other Orientophila species by the substrate preference to tree
barks. Molecular analyses employing ITS and mtSSU sequences clearly
classify O. corticola as a distinct species into the genus Orientophila.
A surrogate key is provided to assist in the identification of all 13
taxa in the genus Orientophila.
